instruction.title:
Scope 1 Emissions from Combustion of Waste Gases 
 Guidance 
 (A) Enter annual data in ORANGE cells as appropriate.  Data should be entered as an organization-wide value (all operations combined prior to entry into this table). 
 (B) Enter total amount waste stream gas combusted. 
 (C) Enter gas total number of moles per ft3.
  - This number is based on specific temperature and pressure conditions.
  - If no data are available use 0.00255 lb-mole/ft3 as a default value, based on conditions of 25oC and 1 atm.
(D) Enter molar fraction (as a percentage) for each gas component in Table 1.
  - This number is based on either volume or molar mass percentage for each gas component.
  - It is assumed that the remainder of the waste stream will be made up of compounds not containing carbon.

footNote.title:
Notes: 
 1.  This tool is designed to apply the CO2 emission factor calculation methodology for a gas waste stream as provided in the Center for Corporate Climate Leadership Greenhouse Gas Inventory Guidance - Direct Emissions from Stationary Combustion Sources (January 2016). This tool can also be used to approximate emissions for other combustion sources such as gas welding and gas metal cutting.
